content: Hi, wondering where this is going at the moment. We would like to build alignment to CDISC standards on top of this.
not going fast - @David Booth @Eric Prud'hommeaux @Michael van der Zel . What would alignment to CDISC mean?

(Adding @Harold Solbrig .) @Geoff Low , glad to hear of your interest! The FHIR ontology download is available here: http://build.fhir.org/downloads.html or more specifically here: http://build.fhir.org/fhir.rdf.ttl.zip What do you think needs to be done for CDISC alignment? Should we discuss it on an upcoming teleconference?

We have to check if the level of the CDISC ontology is the same as FHIR. There is a good document describing it here: https://www.cdisc.org/sites/default/files/members/standard/foundational/rdf/CDISC%20Standards%20RDF%20Reference%20Guide%201.0%20Final%202015-06-18.pdf
It looks like it is a metadata spec, so it should align with the fhir rdf at the metamodel.
Datatypes, a couple of Research specific Resources, like Trial/Study definition, Protocol and DataSet definition. Questionaire is also a bit mixed in, things like question asked to get this data.

Alignment to CDISC at this point would refer allocation of a relationship between a CDISC element (eg VS.VSSTDAT - Date of Vital Signs Observation) and a resource/resource.attribute. At the moment we have this metadata in a spreadsheet (shudder), I know Frederik Malfait (the chief architect of the RDF work at CDISC) is building an ontology for the CDISC metadata. We're also covering C-CDA (specifically CCD) for legacy work, so using an ontology for alignment of that would also be interesting.
@Sam Hume - we should organise a call about this
